clinical_study.brief_title: Open-label, Multi-center Protocol to Provide QTI571 to PAH Patients Who Participated in the Extension Study (A2301E1) in Japan
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label, Multi-center Protocol to Provide QTI571 to PAH Patients Who Participated in the Extension Study (A2301E1) in Japan and Are Judged by the Investigator to Benefit From Continued QTI571 Treatment

oversight_info.authority: Japan: Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices Agency

brief_summary.textblock: To provide continued treatment to Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension (PAH) patients who are benefitting from treatment with QTI571.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.description: All Serious Adverse events will be evaluated and reported for all participants receiving QTI571.

arm_group.description: Participants will receive QTI571 during 3 years.

intervention.description: QTI571 200mg up to 400mg (depending on tolerability) taken orally, once a day.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patient is receiving QTI571 for the treatment of Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension (PAH) and is currectly enrolled in a long-term extension study (CQTI571A2301E1) in Japan.
- Patient is currently benifitting form the treatment with QTI571 in the opinion of the investigator.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient has been permanently discontinued from QTI571 study treatment in the parent study.
- Concomitant use of oral vitamin K antagonist medication.

clinical_study.keyword: Pulmonary arterial hypertension, QTI571, open label study
